info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:26PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHEASTERN BELMONT COUNTIES... At 1125 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cadiz, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... St. Clairsville, Cadiz, Flushing, Adena, Dillonvale, Mount Pleasant, Rayland, New Athens, Harrisville, Newell, Clendening Lake, and Tappan Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
